title.value: Family‐centred care interventions for children with chronic conditions: A scoping review
title.justification: The title is located at the beginning of the document and explicitly states the focus of the paper.
title.quote: Family‐centred care interventions for children with chronic conditions: A scoping review

extractions.description: This paper is a scoping review that aims to identify and characterize family-centred care interventions designed to improve care experiences for children with chronic conditions. The review includes a wide range of interventions across various settings and provides insights into how these interventions are developed and their key components.

type.justification: The paper involves the collection and synthesis of data from various studies to characterize family-centred care interventions, thus qualifying it as an empirical study.
type.quote: We conducted a scoping review that aimed to identify and characterize recent family‐centred interventions designed to improve experiences with care for children with chronic conditions.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on healthcare interventions targeted at children with chronic conditions, aiming to improve family-centred care.
name.quote: Children with chronic conditions have greater health care needs than the general paediatric population but may not receive care that centres their needs and preferences as identified by their families.

name.justification: The paper focuses on interventions that aim to provide family-centred care for children with chronic conditions.
name.quote: Family‐centred care refers to practices that engage patients and their families as integral, valued members involved in decision‐making and appraisal of their health care.

name.justification: The interventions are specifically targeted at children with chronic conditions, placing this research within the field of paediatrics.
name.quote: Children with chronic health conditions or disabilities have elevated health care needs, interact with health care systems more frequently.
